body: Left and right, and far ahead in the dusk.—Now that you notice it—have just moved pastAlong the walls are only empty niches,The edge of that other square cut from the rightPreface to the 1948 EditionScrawny wolves, and you,Reshaping magnified, each risen flakeBy the design of our own silent eyesShe stretches a hand toward the toothy sleeperOf the matter of snow here. Both of us have graspedYes. You'd want that said, (if youIntroduction by Vilhjalmur StefanssonBeneath the snowflakes I notice façadesAppendicesIX. After the Great Northern Expeditionvisitors' dugout. The osprey whose nest is atopAgainst which we have been projected? What . . .In a single floral stroke,I am sleeping, and dreaming, and wandering along
